cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles SE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, then turn N-NE across the Florida Peninsula and emerge over the Atlantic, aiming toward the GA/SC coast late Fri–Sat
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast (likely near the Tampa Bay–Big Bend region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Altamaha Sound, GA to Flagler/Volusia County Line, FL (including the St. Johns River)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastal Georgia and South Carolina from the Altamaha River mouth northward through Savannah and the SC Low-country
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph gusts) possible late Thu night through Fri with a low (10%) chance of sustained 58 mph winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in the Savannah River vicinity if the peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–10 inches of rain possible Fri–Sat leading to flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents ahead of the storm.
